discussion.p: The overload of ssize specified in /18 has no constraints, yet it specializes make_signed_t which has a precondition that its type parameter is an integral type or enumeration but not bool (). This precondition needs to be propagated to ssize as "Mandates [or Constraints]: decltype(c.size()) [meets the requirements for the type argument to make_signed]". "Mandates" seems to be more in line with LWG guidance since there are no traits nor concepts that observe ssize.

blockquote.p: This wording is relative to N4830.

blockquote.pre: template<class C> constexpr auto ssize(const C& c) -> common_type_t<ptrdiff_t, make_signed_t<decltype(c.size())>>;

blockquote.p:
-?- Mandates: decltype(c.size()) is a (possibly cv-qualified) integral or enumeration type but not a bool type.
-18- Returns:
static_cast<common_type_t<ptrdiff_t, make_signed_t<decltype(c.size())>>>(c.size())

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4835.

blockquote.pre: template<class C> constexpr auto ssize(const C& c) -> common_type_t<ptrdiff_t, make_signed_t<decltype(c.size())>>;

blockquote.p:
-?- Mandates: decltype(c.size()) is an integral or enumeration type other than bool.
-18- Returns:
static_cast<common_type_t<ptrdiff_t, make_signed_t<decltype(c.size())>>>(c.size())
